increase tilt angle (tilt UP) due reduce cluttered signals from ground surface.
increase tilt angle (tilt UP) due "look" into altitude with ice crystals at high levels instead of supercooled water for better reflectivity.
reduce tilt angle (tilt DOWN) due "look" into compensate for the curvature of the earth's surface at large distances.

question: What is the main function of a Airborne Weather Radar?

decrease altitude, cross the thunderstorm above the freezing level.
pass the thunderstorm close to the down-wind side, try to pass through areas with quickly changing colours.

a sphere with its centre at the receiver.

is able to detect one faulty signal and is able to identify the faulty one.

question: Which of the following correctly lists the most significant factors affecting the accuracy of the Satellite-Assisted Navigation System (GNSS/GPS)?

the coverage area of an SBAS is much larger than that of a GBAS.
